item.title: Charlene add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description:
"Do you hate people?
I don't hate them...I just feel better when they're not around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "Some people never go crazy. What truly horrible lives they must lead." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Jim Carroll
item.description: "Conscience is no more than the dead speaking to us." -- Jim Carroll

item.title: Charlene add a quote by William S. Burroughs
item.description: "A paranoid is someone who knows a little of what's going on. " -- William S. Burroughs

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Have you ever been in love? Horrible isn't it? It makes you so vulnerable. It opens your chest and it opens up your heart and it means that someone can get inside you and mess you up." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Bernard M. Baruch
item.description: "Be who you are and say what you feel, because those who mind don't matter, and those who matter don't mind." -- Bernard M. Baruch

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Friedrich Nietzsche
item.description: "Without music, life would be a mistake." -- Friedrich Nietzsche

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "May your coming year be filled with magic and dreams and good madness. I hope you read some fine books and kiss someone who thinks you're wonderful, and don't forget to make some art -- write or draw or build or sing or live as only you can. And I hope, somewhere in the next year, you surprise yourself." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "What I say is, a town isn't a town without a bookstore. It may call itself a town, but unless it's got a bookstore it knows it's not fooling a soul." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Neil Gaiman
item.description: "Tomorrow may be hell, but today was a good writing day, and on the good writing days nothing else matters." -- Neil Gaiman

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Serenity is when you get above all this, when it doesn't matter what they think, say or want, but when you do as you are, and see God and Devil as one." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Henry Miller
item.description: "Destiny is what you are supposed to do in life. Fate is what kicks you in the ass to make you do it." -- Henry Miller

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Love never dies a natural death. It dies because we don't know how to replenish its source. It dies of blindness and errors and betrayals. It dies of illness and wounds; it dies of weariness, of witherings, of tarnishings." -- Anais Nin

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "How wrong is it for a woman to expect the man to build the world she wants, rather than to create it herself?" -- Anais Nin

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "In three words I can sum up everything I've learned about life: it goes on." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Robert Frost
item.description: "Never be bullied into silence. Never allow yourself to be made a victim. Accept no oneâ€™s definition of your life; define yourself." -- Robert Frost

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Neal Cassady
item.description: "Sometimes I sits and thinks. Other times I sits and drinks, but mostly I just sits." -- Neal Cassady

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Anais Nin
item.description: "Our life is composed greatly from dreams, from the unconscious, and they must be brought into connection with action. They must be woven together. " -- Anais Nin

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Tim Burton
item.description:
"Voodoo Girl Her skin is white cloth, and she's all sewn apart and she has many colored pins sticking out of her heart.
She has many different zombies who are deeply in her trance. She even has a zombie who was originally from France.
But she knows she has a curse on her, a curse she cannot win. For if someone gets too close to her,
the pins stick farther in." -- Tim Burton

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Tim Burton
item.description: "When you donâ€™t have many friends and you donâ€™t have a social life youâ€™re kind of left looking at things, not doing things. Thereâ€™s a weird freedom in not having people treat you like youâ€™re part of society or where you have to fulfill social relationships." -- Tim Burton

item.title: Charlene add a quote by John Saul
item.description: "The country would be far better if the population were half as interested in keeping their minds in as good condition as they tried to keep their bodies." -- John Saul

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "...the Bible is probably the most genocidal book in the literary canon." -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Noam Chomsky
item.description: "How it is we have so much information, but know so little?" -- Noam Chomsky

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "Anybody who says they are a good liar obviously is not, because any legitimately savvy liar would always insist they're honest about everything." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "I once loved a girl who almost loved me, but not as much as she loved John Cusack." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Chuck Klosterman
item.description: "Do you know people who insist they like 'all kinds of music'? That actually means they like <I>no kinds</i> of music." -- Chuck Klosterman

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I've never been lonely. I've been in a room -- I've felt suicidal. I've been depressed. I've felt awful -- awful beyond all -- but I never felt that one other person could enter that room and cure what was bothering me...or that any number of people could enter that room. In other words, loneliness is something I've never been bothered with because I've always had this terrible itch for solitude. It's being at a party, or at a stadium full of people cheering for something, that I might feel loneliness. I'll quote Ibsen, "The strongest men are the most alone." I've never thought, "Well, some beautiful blonde will come in here and give me a fuck-job, rub my balls, and I'll feel good." No, that won't help. You know the typical crowd, "Wow, it's Friday night, what are you going to do? Just sit there?" Well, yeah. Because there's nothing out there. It's stupidity. Stupid people mingling with stupid people. Let them stupidify themselves. I've never been bothered with the need to rush out into the night. I hid in bars, because I didn't want to hide in factories. That's all. Sorry for all the millions, but I've never been lonely. I like myself. I'm the best form of entertainment I have. Let's drink more wine!" -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I don't hate people. I just feel better when they aren't around." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Charles Bukowski
item.description: "I felt like crying but nothing came out. it was just a sort of sad sickness, sick sad, when you can't feel any worse. I think you know it. I think everybody knows it now and then. but I think I have known it pretty often, too often." -- Charles Bukowski

item.title: Charlene add a quote by Marcus Tullius Cicero
item.description: "A room without books is like a body without a soul." -- Marcus Tullius Cicero
